post_body_text: The month of March is Women's History Month and as a member of the New York State Legislative Women's Caucus, I had the opportunity to recognize a woman from my district who goes above and beyond each and every day! I selected my dear friend and neighbor, Sally Ellms. You may recognize Sally from Ellms Family Farm! Sally is married to Chip and they have three children and seven lovely grandchildren. She was a teacher for 29+ years in Atlanta, Maine and Burnt Hills-Ballston Lake Central School District. Sally and Chip moved to Charlton and started Ellms Christmas Trees in 1984 and Ellms Family Farm in 2005. She is active in the Christmas Tree Farmers Association of New York and Ellms became a collection site farm for Trees for Troops (one of my favorite annual events!) almost 20 years ago. Sally is also active in her community, having served on Charlton's Comprehensive Planning Committee and the PTA. She currently is a member of the Burnt Hills-Ballston Lake Education Foundation, the Charlton Seniors and volunteer for Meals on Wheels and Charlton Founders‚Äô Day. Thanks for everything, Sally! I am so proud to recognize you for all the great things that you do.
The Atlanta native says it's a small way to give back during a season that highlights those who need kindness the most.
